data.title: How to customize Sonicwall SSL VPN url?
data.meta_description: Hi, instead of my users going to https://xx.xx.xx.xx:4433 I’d like them to go to vpn.domainname.com. What do I need to do to get that done? Is it just a matter of a DNS record with the domain registrar? If so, what type …
data.text:
Hi, instead of my users going to https://xx.xx.xx.xx:4433 I’d like them to go to vpn.domainname.com. What do I need to do to get that done? Is it just a matter of a DNS record with the domain registrar? If so, what type of record should I be using?

So just add an A record? Host being “vpn” and “Points to” being the external IP of the Sonicwall? Will I still need to put the port number at the end of the url?

Yes, just create the A record vpn and point to the VPN IP of the SonicWALL. You can’t specify the port in an A record. You will need to add that to your connection URL.

To add to that, what I do is change the management port from 443 go 444, then the SSLVPN listening port to 443. This way your users don’t have to specify a port in the URL.
